body: Thanks for posting it in a separate Issue, will try to replicate and get back to you soon.

Hello same here with not a very different and simple model. In my case the error shows OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument: 'results\\class_probabilities_<UNK>.npy'

**the exact command I am executing >>>>**   (ludwigenv) C:\Users\GT>ludwig predict --dataset C:/GT/TestKyri/Jan2018AplicarMod.csv --model_path C:/Users/GT/results/experiment_run/model

**the config.yaml file describing the network model >>>>**{input_features: [{name: doc_text, type: text}], output_features: [{name: class, type: category}]}


[logs.zip](https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig/files/7566997/logs.zip)

Please read the erro as follows instead as UNK and signes does not show up in the posted text  >>>>   OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument: 'results\\class_probabilities_"smaller than sign" UNK "bigger than sign".npy'
@maragato2000 getting back to this now, sorry for the delay. Can yo utry with the current 0.5rc2 version? It hsoudl have fixed the issue.

@maragato2000 we are going to change the dependency structure to have torchvision, torchtext and torchaudio as main dependencies, but for the time being those dependencies are part of subpackages. Fort torchvision in particular the `[image]` subpackage contains it. I suggest you create a new env for ludwig 0.5rc2, if you install from a local git clone, I'd do `pip install .[image]` for instance.

Thank you Piero,
I made to run... now I am phasing another issue on which i need your help.
This has already been raised and i believe it will be quickly be fixed.

While trying to prejudice on  a text classification with this:

 If i* run it without a slash before de model_path  *(LudwigEnv)
C:\Users\GT>ludwig
predict --dataset C:/GT/TestKyri/Jan2018AplicarMod.csv --model_path
C:/Users/GT/results/experiment_run_3/model
>> i obtain this error message:  OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument:
'C:/Users/GT/results/class_probabilities_<UNK>.csv'

So UNK appears unresolved  on the results probabilities instead of the 3
value i would have expected to see ...

If i* run it with a slash before de model_path*         (LudwigEnv)
C:\Users\GT>ludwig predict --dataset C:/GT/TestKyri/Jan2018AplicarMod.csv
--model_path */*C:/Users/GT/results/experiment_run_3/model
>> I obtain this error message:  OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument:
'/C:/Users/GT/results/experiment_run_3/model\\model_weights'

So what (other) command should be run to get it working correctly ?

Thanks !
Mara

@maragato2000 it seems to me you are on a windows machine, judging from the prompt, have you tried using regular windows paths? The error `'/C:/Users/GT/results/experiment_run_3/model\\model_weights'` suggests that the directory model_weigths is added to the path correctly following the windows convention, but the path up to that point was not, which is the one you provided.

So can you try just:
```
C:\Users\GT>ludwig predict --dataset C:\GT\TestKyri\Jan2018AplicarMod.csv
--model_path C:\Users\GT\results\experiment_run_3\model
```
?

Im afraid it throws still the same similar error:  OSError: [Errno 22]
Invalid argument: 'C:/Users/GT/results/class_probabilities_<UNK>.

I am using Windows yes  as i you say but something tells me your code takes
this as a string with an embedded variable to handle the number of run, and
executes in Python which has the slash convention different from the
windows path.  Something indeed goes wrong on your python code when
handling this... Maybe linked to the fact that the mode_path requires to
start with a /

The closer i get is when using ludwig predict --dataset
C:/GT/TestKyri/Jan2018AplicarMod.csv --model_path
/C:/Users/GT/results/experiment_run_3/model/

But still getting OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument:
'/C:/Users/GT/results/experiment_run_3/model/model_weights'


Best Regards,
GT

Thank you Piero and Ba

Yes the PR #1830 was aimed at resolving this issues for artefacts created from URL paths on windows machines. This looks like a different code path but the fix might be similar once we can repo issue.
Closing this issue @manivannansp, please re-open if you still have questions. Thanks!
